thread.title: BCCI-PCB meet rescheduled in Delhi from Mumbai; Mamata Banerjee offers to host meeting in Kolkata
thread.title_full: BCCI-PCB meet rescheduled in Delhi from Mumbai; Mamata Banerjee offers to host meeting in Kolkata

author: Mohammed Uzair Shaikh
title: BCCI-PCB meet rescheduled in Delhi from Mumbai; Mamata Banerjee offers to host meeting in Kolkata
text:
BCCI-PCB meet rescheduled in Delhi from Mumbai; Mamata Banerjee offers to host meeting in Kolkata By Mohammed Uzair Shaikh on October 19, 2015 at 2:34 PM Comments 
Mumbai, Oct 19: After a stormy protest and threat of disruption from Shiv Sena, the meeting between the top brass of BCCI and Pakistan Cricket Board is scheduled in Delhi. It will be held on Tuesday evening. The surprising announcement was made nearly a hour after the cricketing body called off the meet due to the hooliganism shown by Shiv Sena. 
The meet was originally scheduled to take place in the BCCI headquarters in Mumbai. However, the intimidation shown by the extreme-right outfit forced the authorities to change the venue. PCB president Shahryar Khan along with executive committee head Najam Sethi are expected to reach the Indian national capital by tomorrow. From the BCCI, newly appointed chief Shashank Manohar and secretary Anurag Thakur will meet the officials of PCB. (ALSO READ: Shiv Sena storms BCCI office in Mumbai; threatens Shashank Manohar to cancel meet with PCB chief Shahryar Khan) 
The discussion will likely focus upon re-initiating cricket ties between the two nations. According to reports, PCB will demand BCCI to allow Indian players to participate in domestic leagues in the neighbnouring countries, along with restarting annual bilateral series between the two countries. 
To counter the anti-Pakistan propaganda of Shiv Sena, West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee has offered to host the meeting in the state capital of Kolkata under a fully secure environment. “Hearing about incidents related to disruption of BCCI work in Mumbai. Cricket Board is welcomed to meet in Kolkata,” Banerjee said. 
  2:37 PM Topics:
